page.title: 15The Coaching Town
page.content: In the 18th century Boroughbridge reached the peak of its prosperity. It was a halting place for stage coaches and a marketing centre. The first ever mail coach from London to the north of the town stopped at Boroughbridge for meals and for accommodation.These coach services brought trade to Boroughbridge.The Crown Hotel was one of several other inns and it had stabling for over a hundred horses.The Three Horse Shoes inn got its name from all the stabling and coaching they had there.All the inns had special places for their coaches to get in the courts which were usually at the rear of the inn.
